Author: Sledge0001
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Well after being on WinMiner for 2 1/4 days here are my impressions and stats....  First and foremost they did payout my $100 withdrawal request within 18 minutes via Litecoin when I opted to proceed with a withdrawal. Yeah!!!!  Second I emailed them about Vertcoin being removed which took about 28 hours for them to respond via a professional and honest written email. (Not bad considering that they are most likely scrambling at this point) and its now back in service. In my opinion Not bad at all.  To the numbers side of things:  My 5 rigs that are using their systems and here is what I am throwing at them....  1. Core I7, 1 X 980TI and 1 1060 3GB (The cheapies 03G-P4-6160-KR) 2. Core I7, 1 X 1060 6GB 3. Core I5, 8 X 1080 (Non TI versions) 4. Core I5, 9 X 1060 3GB  (The cheapies 03G-P4-6160-KR) 5. Core I5, 8 X 1060 3GB  (The cheapies 03G-P4-6160-KR)  So...Within 2 1/2  - 2 1/4 days I have earned $103 and pulled out $100. This would have been about $120-$130 on Nicehash. MUCH BETTER THAN MINERGATE!!!!!  My thoughts are this...  Initially it set off Windows Defender and Sophos antivirus systems badly... It took some noodling to place the files in a non scanned folder to get everything to work as intended.  Winminer .... It does work and its not a bad system at all. The UI isn't bad although it has hickuped a few times what I see is that it is really missing GPU temps and fan speeds.  Winminer's switching between mining pools /algos takes a bit longer than I would prefer. NH would do this rapidly however it seems as if with the WinMiner seems to take an extra minute or so to figure out which algo to work on.  Winminer does struggle with picking the best algo to use / mine. I have watched and noodled throughout the day on trying to figure out what pays best with my hardware. Sometimes its VTC,  other times its ZEN and sometimes HUSH. As said previously the system does not always seem to pick the best algo.  Winminer software has only crashed 1 time on 1 of my 5 machines all of which are using pretty heavy overclocks so I am not seeing their software crash as many others have reported.  I am not getting pixilation or any other issues while running Winminer on any of my 5 rigs although I did have to clear my benchmarks on Day 1 to get my CPU's involved...  Given the influx of new members I am sure that are many trying to join this system they are slammed in all shapes and forms but are trying to keep up.  Overall I am not unhappy with their system or service and I hope they continue to improve on their UI, add more coins and work on their automated coin / profit selection software.  My Honest rating 8.5 out of 10.

Author: csmcc
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Tried the portable version last night.  Shut itself down within an hour or two - multiple times. Left miners running as background processes even once the GUI had already crashed out. Numbers never updated. Coin choices seemed all wrong. If it actually managed to run for more than an hour or two before crashing, the returns (based on the bench's and predictions it was showing me) would have been considerably less than NH.  NH was always stable. Never had crashing issues with it. Machine is stable. Nothing is OC'd. Pretty much everything non-essential was removed form startup long ago.  So, for now, I'm back to running BOINC (which is also nice and stable) for GRC on all available devices. But I'll need to set up some alternative mining on the GFX card to cover the running costs. Was hoping it would be this. But it seems way unreliable to me. Gonna pull the finger out and just run a direct miner I think.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Guys,  We have been working like crazy and continuously in the last 36 hours to scale our operation to support the extreme influx of users. WinMiner has grown 10 times in size in just 24 hours which is very challenging for any business..We are now temporarily limiting the addition of new users to allow the system to stabilize. We know this has not been a smooth ride for us nor for you guys who use WinMiner, and so a big thank is in order -  Thank you all WinMiners for your patience and support - we are on this and we are getting this fixed.  Team WinMiner (desperately needing some sleep  )

Until now, all you NiceHash refugees (sorry but you can't be a migrant by definition) ruined it for us early adopters....and yet you lash out at dev's skills for something that's totally free of your choice in using it or not....  think no country/government could have dealt with a refugee influx 10 folds of its own population without affecting the welfare of its own citizens...thus don't be hasty to judge.

Author: LasersHurt
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Thanks! I actually knew these things, but it's always good to refresh.  What I'm saying is that I set it for "Regular" benchmark and it did not try all combinations. It only tried one, and stopped trying any further. Likewise, the "Benchmarking" message has been stuck on the UI, regardless of whether or not the app was actually benchmarking anything.  I've seen the "expected" process on my other machine, so I know what it should look like. Ran them all, message went away, began mining as expected, switching as expected. All is well on that machine.  Now, I didn't know that it would re-check every 24 hours, so I guess I can just let it sit and when jobs return see if it actually does so. Still, I wouldn't be mad at a method to ensure I've cleared it of all benchmarks and try to start from scratch, if it's at all possible. If not, I can afford to wait and see.  Good luck with your growing pains! I know how it goes, I'm sure you'll get it all sorted out soon.  Edit: I'll be damned if I didn't kill both instances this morning, re-launch, and it went and benchmarked everything. Now it's doing precisely what I'd expect. Chalk it up to the issues of rapid expansion or just weird luck, but it's working like a charm now.

Author: LasersHurt
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Hi Guys! Like the project, but I've got a bit of an odd issue I'm hoping you can help with.  On my multi-card rig, some sort of error occurred during benchmarking. This has resulted in the UI perpetually showing "Benchmarking - Target: (value)/day (ETN+PIRL)" despite the fact that it's not benchmarking anything. Instead, it completely benchmarked the one Nvidia card, but all 4 AMD cards have been on ZEN and ZEN only since I started. Checking the Benchmark history, it just didn't even try to bench anything else for the AMD cards.  Interestingly, I tried uninstalling and reinstalling, thinking this would force it to re-benchmark everything, but it seems that once again the AMD cards are straight to mining zen while the Nvidia goes through a series of benchmarks.  Am I nuts? On my other rig, a single AMD card, it benchmarked as expected and has switched here and there as profits moved around.  Is there any way to ensure I have truly knocked out all previous benchmarks and really start from a clean slate on the multi-card rig?

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Welcome aboard! Here is a quick explanation about benchmarking on WinMiner - (1) Benchmarking - Target - This metric shows up before benchmarking takes place, and it is based on crowd wisdom logic - it analyzes the performance of very similar hardware by other users on WinMiner and gives out an expected target metric. The idea is that users will have an estimate of what realistically they can expect before the full cycle of benchmarking is completed. (2) Benchmark modes -     (a) Express (default) - in this mode the benchmarking will commence with the combination most likely to provide the best performance for the specific hardware, and then once in a while attempt a different combination to make sure the best combination is indeed the one being mined. This mode gets a user up and running with max performance asap.     (b) Regular Benchmark - in this mode all combinations will be tried out, one by one until the most profitable combination is chosen In addition, once every 24 hours hardware will be examined per each algo for hash poer performance.  Hope this clarifies :-)

Author: JY0512
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Some concerning freezes.  Startup on windows is disabled, yet it is still enabled to startup on log on in the task scheduler.  Start Windows WinMiner Autoloads Start Mining If command screen hide option is checked, then the winminer main screen will be frozen in place and not respond to any clicks Only gpu command screen pops up when hitting start.  EDIT Seems to be a gui problem, the checkmark near the cpu will be checked but only the gpu will start. Clicking on the checkmark will result in a program window refresh and then the checkmark will be applied, as though it was never checked before.  Also seems to be using old winminer config files, since sometimes it would try to do the autostart delay even though it was unchecked. maybe files werent written correctly or force closing through task manager messed it up.  Last EDIT Balance seems to be working great, is updating and in line with what I should be getting.

Author: Phantoms001
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Not only that, you can cash out when ever you want at Winminer.  With nicehash you have to wait till they decide to pay you.   With nicehash you run the risk of a bitcoin drop negating any profits for you mining (because they pay in bitcoin you earn a % of bitcoin a day.  If bitcoin drops the value of what you mine drops), this happened to me 4x and I was pretty much done with nicehash.  I would mine for 10 days and lose about 20% of the value because bitcoin went down when they paid me out.  Because Winminer pays you in USD immediately, if I earn 15.00 today, I will have 15.00 in my wallet even if bitcoin drops by 1/2 tomorrow.   You can buy the dips...If you are interested in keeping some bitcoin, eth, ltc, ect.... you aren't stuck at a certain price point.  You can keep the money in your wallet and when a coin drops purchase the coin rather than being stuck at an "all time high".  You can wait a few days and get in a coin at a price point you are comfortable with.   Winminer is just better all around....

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: We understand that you are very passionate about this feature and we know you are not the only one. We love the comments and requests that we get from you and from all the users here, but you have to understand that there will always be more things to do then we can possibly do quickly. This feature/functionality will definitely be added, but we have no delivery date for that at this moment. We would not be here without the great support from you guys and we wish we could just add all the great features, coins, payment methods, algos etc that you guys mention, as you request them. We know this may not be the answer you were hoping to get, but you can be sure that we are working as hard as we possibly can to make WinMiner the best product, that will make you guys happy.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: We definitely want to get to the bottom of this. A couple of questions: (1) Were you guys on "all coins" or a specific coin (2) Were you guys on "all miners" or did you work with specific miners (3) Were you able to see the miner actually running at that specific time or the machine was running unattended at that time? (4) We would need your email address so we can look up the details You are welcome to do one of the following: - Provide all this information in an email to our support support [at] winminer.com; or - Send an error report (Help > send error report) and write all the information in the comment space

Author: AlexanderDumas
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: First of all congratulations with the nice application. It just works straight out of the box even for a novice like me.. Last week it allowed me to get up and running on a regular PC which I normally use for Photoshop work, within minutes, not knowing anything about this "Mining Thing" at all. I have been lurking around sites and miners for the past few days and for somebody novice is rather complicated, and not because it is very complicated... but because generally the documentation is very light, not well written and is not professional, which is going to be a put off for a lot of people. Said that, WinMiner was the easiest of all to get on going, at least for me. The possibility of automatically switching miner and currency on a snap, is what makes this application more interesting of the other popular ones, together with the possibility of taking you payment out in Paypal as well.  I have installed one of those Vegas 56, followed few tutorials and got it to work for XMR at an average 1950Hs reliably at 65C, and 135W, without BIOS hack, using "cast_vega_xmr" miner. Unfortunately this miner is not available on WinMiner and I was wondering if you have planned of adopting it in the future. For XMR, WinMiner uses Claymore which run the Vega 56 at a maximum of 1435Hs, that makes at current today exchange a difference of 1.2 USD per day. Also mining ethereum in winminer the Vegas reach only 29Mh max instead of the 43MH that is capable of.  Since I have bought 3 more Vegas and I'll be setting up a rig next week, i was hoping "cast_vega_xmr" will be on your plans. People are buying Vegas like there is no tomorrow, they are almost sold out everywhere.  Thank you for your hard work and cheers!

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Thanks for the warm words   We totally understand your concern but it is very important to understand the difference between profit calculator data and real life mining data. While they should be pretty much the same, in reality it is not always the case, especially when it comes to new and volatile coins such as BTG. If you look up the price of BTG at this very moment you will see that the price on Yobit is about $250 whereas on coinmarketcap.com its $158, and this is still only on paper and not a real market selling price Recently, we had the opposite situation with ETH where calculators missed an opportunity to mine ETH that WinMiner users enjoyed. Another recent example was a drop in the block size of EXP from 8 to 4 that was not updated on various calculators for a couple of days.  Our point is that when comparing, you have to compare the commitment behind the numbers - a calculator data has no commitment behind it (The calculator site will not commit to buy your hash power at the rate shown by the calculator) it is an estimated/theoretical number that could be very detached from real life data.  As BTG becomes more stable with greater volume and visibility the discrepancy between calculator estimates and real mining numbers should hopefully diminish.  Hope this clarifies.  Re Cryptonight nVidia - Are you referring to CCminer? is there other miner you have good experience with? e.g.  XMR-cast?

Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: I am also having the connect issues.  Also, when it does connect my two machines mine and I checked the command window and they are mining. Maybe your systems are down and profit will show up later but can't trust your site yet.  For all I know, your pool kept it.  Also, if your system is down consistently and always catching up, you will loose the audience that you are shooting for.  They want to see the profit balance move.  I realize that you are still new.  I will definately support it rather than nicehash once you guys get your system more stable.  I love the idea and interface is more clean than nicehash.  Also, seems to be a bit more profit but with transfer fees may even out to nicehash.  I like the idea of being able to cash in alt coins. Author: SirDRagonx
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: I am definitely not counting them out!  I realize they are new and see some great potential!  I think they can even overcome nicehash with their interface and payment options  which gives flexibility.  I am just holding out a little bit for them to stabilize again and move my rigs over to them.  I am not putting them down.  Just offering my 2 cents.  I honestly think they are doing awesome given the newness.  Just can't afford to loose money on my rigs.  I am experimenting though.  Also, I see people complaining about fees.  I use nicehash with their internal wallet and then transfer out when I have a large amount which is cheaper than going to an external wallet.  I see the profits being about the same with transfer fees including the paypal fees if you do it right.  I think this is very good alternative and hope it keeps improving because it gives people more choice.  Also nicehash all depends on the people buying the hashing power and I have seen dips at times.  With this you are mining the actual coin it seems which gets converted to dollars and if you want bitcoin then they offer an option for it and transferring even with fees comes to about the same with my calculations so far.  Winminer depends on the volatility of the coins not people buying contracts which I think is a plus and more stable in the long run in my opinion.  So all I have to say is great work and please don't take my criticism as trashing the program.  It is only to help you guys improve and I am believing in it already!  Just not convinced enough to move my operation over yet but I am confident that I will very soon after some more testing!  On another note.  The software reads all my 1070 cards and one 1080ti card on my rig.  But when it starts hashing it shows my 1080 ti hashing at the same rate at my 1070s and it shows one of my 1070s hashing at the rate that my 1080ti should be hashing.  So I get the right hash rate but the software is reporting on the wrong card.  Not sure if this is a known issue.

Body: I've got 2 card in my computer - an old Radeon 2600 XT and a new GTX 1060. I was thinking I'd use the 2600 as I normally would for Windows, and let the 1060 be dedicated for mining.  As I understand it, winminer doesn't yet allow deselecting a card for mining.  Am I better off: a) leaving both cards in, or b) remove the 2600, and use the 1060 to drive my display and mine?  I'm guessing mining on both is a waste of money, and I see no benefit from a dedicated card for running my monitor as it's mining on it anyway.  h

Author: Phantoms001
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: That is really why I use it.   I sold 400.00 in BitCoin today.  It cost me about 6.00 to transfer it from my wallet to the exchange and 15.95 to sell it on the exchange.   It is usually cheaper to just cash it out straight to my paypal.     A few months ago it would cost a dollar to send 50.00 with bitcoin.  I couldn't send bitcoin 3 days ago because it was about 9.00 to do a transaction, 13.xx to send it priority.  That is simply crazy.  While the fees have dipped down a little, bitcoin is still expensive to send.  Then bitcoin is slow as dirt.  My last transaction took almost 3 days sending it with "normal" priority.  I could have snail mailed it faster.  Bitcoin has huge problems.  It is no longer a currency.  It is just a speculation for people that hope it goes up so they can make a few dollars.   If you are looking just to dump (which is why people use nicehash and winminer) compared to having to sell a coin on an exchange 3% isn't bad, and most of the time you come out ahead.

Author: Pilgrim75
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: This is the usual behavior of any currency, on the growing or lateral movement, growth and then pullback. Take for example Sumo. On the first day when the pump occurred, I saw how all the farms switched to sumo extraction, then within 2 days as the price changed, they returned to it. You can even without turning to the charts of the stock exchange set up an algorithm in which: If the farms switch to some kind of currency after a while, then there is a chance that this action will be repeated and you can reduce the number of switching operations by extracting the currency whose growth we expect. For the peak of sales, consider the moment when it becomes profitable for extraction. In this method, there are both pluses and minuses, and therefore the user himself must decide whether he needs this lottery)

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: 1. Payment  We are not aware of any payment issues at the moment. Most likely you have not confirmed the withdrawal request by clicking the link in the withdrawal email. Here is how it works - To complete a withdrawal request you need to confirm the withdrawal by clicking the confirmation link in the email you receive immediately after making the request. This process was created to safeguard users funds against potential errors and unauthorized withdrawals. For the same reason the withdrawal process (including the confirmation) must be completed within 10 minutes. To start again you need to do the following:   (1) Cancel the existing withdrawal request. (2) Submit a new withdrawal request. (3) Click the confirmation link in the email you will receive following your new withdrawal request, WITHIN 10 minutes.  If you need any further assistance we are here for you at support [at] winminer.com  2. One rig sudden stop  Please send an error report (Help > Send Error Report) and right your name so we can know its you.  Our support team will gladly help with that or with any other issue

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Happy Tuesday everyone!!  We have a new release - v1.86a  and some great news -  (1) Litecoin has been added to the payment options You guys wanted it and we are happy to deliver. Now you have the option to withdraw your balance in LTC, enjoy fast confirmations and low fees.  (2) Extra Command Line user customization - Phase 3, is here. Now further customization is possible so any user can create his preferred config file for a specific miner. Squeezing the max of your hardware is now in your hands..  (3) BTC withdraw - Added a higher fee option Now you can decide if you want to pay higher fees for faster transfer of BTC. We recommend checking the fee and the BTC network congestion before using this option - it is costly but fast!  Enjoy, and share!  Last but not least, we have quiet a lot of special thanks today:  (1) Special thanks to all those asking for Litecoin or BTC/ETH alternative with fast confirmations and low fees -    Quote from: Eyedol-X on October 15, 2017, 10:50:05 PM I'm not sure if it's a current option but personally I'd like to see LTC, ETC, XMR, and ZEC payout options. Quote from: inkubux on July 11, 2017, 05:22:33 PM Are you planning on adding more withdraw options ? Litecoin would be awesome. It's fast and transaction fees are low. Quote from: halker2010 on August 28, 2017, 03:15:48 AM The interface has been improved very much I love it but can you add webmoney or litecoin payment method ? Quote from: crazyearner on August 12, 2017, 11:17:51 PM Provide more support for withdraw coins that are available to mine.   (2) Special thanks to all those asking for special configuration capabilities  Quote from: Croco69 on October 25, 2017, 10:52:07 PM I cannot still configure the miner xmr-stack , the config file is overwritten at each start of the miner Quote from: mystere_miner on August 26, 2017, 06:04:20 PM Also, please add a way that we can tweak the miners.. adjusting intensity, and other parameters.   Quote from: abudfv2008 on July 11, 2017, 01:01:26 PM 0 30 70 100 is not enough. These works for 1060/1070, usually somewhere around 35-50-60. But for 1080/1080ti 200+ ... 400+ is more profitable nowadays (LBRY usually ~480-500 on 1080Ti) And as for AMD cards and GTX1060 dcri should be changed very presicely. E.g. right now on 1xFuri Eth+DCR dcri30=2.40 dcri36 =2.69$, dcri40 = 2.59 dcri50=2.30 First to implement realtime optimizing of dcri setting will get many users. Quote from: preda on July 12, 2017, 10:27:20 AM About the -dcri i have been testing for a while in all options and i can tell you that -dcri 23 is the best for all cards. Try it. Quote from: Calrornds on August 27, 2017, 05:03:25 PM - As some have already suggested, dcri control and voltage control are critical, my RX580 needs a 38 dcri and my RX560 a 24 dcri, so they are not working at their best now while mining EXP. Quote from: 4ward on September 05, 2017, 05:49:44 PM Quote from: _Dejan_ on September 05, 2017, 05:03:36 AM Code: 18:47:34:701 159c Logical CPU cores: 8 18:47:34:702 159c Number of threads: Autoselection... 18:47:34:702 159c Using 4 threads We need custom miner settings ASAP... Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: There are two types of benchmark methods in WinMiner:  (1) Express Benchmark (Default) - Here your machine will begin to mine the coin that is most likely to max your profits. WinMiner determines that based on our unique crowd wisdom Dynamic Algo and your hardware. It will then check from time to time, over 24 hours, other coins to make sure your machine profits are at max. (2) Traditional Benchmark - In this mode WinMiner will test all iterations, one after the other, to find the most profitable one.  In both cases, periodic tests will be performed every 24 hours to make sure your performance is on track.   You can choose which of those suites you. If you prefer the traditional Benchmark then please uncheck the "Express benchmark" option in the settings.

Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: WinMiner mines both ETH and ETC - its all a matter of which is the most profitable (taking into account the difficulty, price etc..) at any given moment...

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Here is how it works: 1. The coin being mined is shown in real time on the WinMiner Interface 2. Benchmark results - Here we show the results for the most profitable coin per algo - in the case you described you were seeing ETC there and not ETH because it was, at that specific time, more profitable to mine than ETH Hope this clarifies

Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Same, reason I started digging into the logs and posted on the forums. You can't tell me that over the course of 2-3 months that ETH hasn't been more profitable to mine than ETC at least once. For my miners to not have a single benchmark for the algo or price decision seems a little off. Right now it's mining EXP+DCR with est of $8.59 daily earnings. I can go straight ETH mining with an estimated $13.40 daily earnings, not to mention the additional earning from mining a second algo, SIA, DCR etc.  I'll clear benchmark results and see if it picks up ETH and mines that instead but I doubt it since it hasn't yet.

Author: skyviper80
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: It still won't mine ETH without disabling all other Coins. However I did look at the miner it's using and noticed it's using a dcri value of 100 to mine ETH/DCR which mines approx $7.07 per day. I changed config to show command screen and adjusted dcri down to 30 and it's performing as I would expect it to, earning $9.46 per day. Hashing went from about 13-14 M/Hs per card to 25-26 M/hs per card. Is there a way to manually adjust the settings for specific algos yet? Cause the ones WinMiner is using are terrible.

Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization

Author: skyviper80
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Shortly after posting all of this my miner started to mine ETH+DCR constantly which it wouldn't do before.  Also, I uninstalled the previous drivers and finally installed the AMD blockchain drivers and the new MSI Afterburner 4.4.0 Beta 19. Must say I should have done it long time ago cause this thing is mining like a champ now.  Reset all benchmarks and let it run a new set of benchmarks and it's mining ETH+DCR @ 29.6M/Hs+889M/Hs per card. It all seems to be running well again.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Hallelujah!!

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Here is how it works (for now ) - we are working towards a more frequently updated system. 1. Users' mining shares are being logged in our database all the time. 2. Users' balance (which is calculated based on all the shares data) display on the statistics page gets refreshed at least once per hour (at which time all shares data are counted and balance reward is being calculated for all users) 3. To help new users get better system acquaintance we enable a more frequent refresh rate of the balance data for new users (we are working to scale the system so we can enable this for all users). 4. Graphs are updated slightly less frequent than the balance - we are working on that as well. Hope this clarifies

Being able to cash out into paypal or bitcoin when ever I want far outweighs any small nuance.  For example, when bitcoin drops, I can cash out into bitcoin.  When bitcoin is up, I just keep my balance in winminer.  I can just keep buying dips.  With nicehash, several times bitcoin dropped when I got paid out which lowered my profit for the period.  You can make quite a bit by just buying the dips, far exceeding any fees charged. Can you please share some more info? - e.g. which miner software are you using? what parameters? OC?

Body: Dear Winminer team,  I seem to notice that i never get the amount of $$ per day that Winminer is reporting. Actually i get much less.  E.g. The last few days i kept checking Winminer all the time and i was getting an average total production of $10 sometimes $11 sometimes $9.50. I will give you the minimum i should be getting, which is a total per day of $9 and this is the very minimum if we take into consideration benchmark times and coin changing times.  At the end of each day when i looked at my total, per day, i got only around $6-7. This means i'm loosing $3 per day average which is $90 monthly!!!  Please let me know what is the problem. I'm thinking of abandoning winminer until this issue is fixed. It happened to me again 3-4 weeks ago and i opened a ticked which was never answered back. Then it stopped. Now again it started happening. Until i get an answer i'm out.  The potential here is great as long as these issues are solved.

Highlights:  (1)   Greater optimization for mixed rigs â€“ Now you can run one algo/miner/coin for AMD cards and a different one for Nvidia cards on the same rig (different algo/miner/coin per each GPU is not yet possible â€“ always room to grow..:-) (2)   Benchmark estimation â€“ -   Crowd wisdom â€“ New and updated benchmark data based on performance achieved by other users with similar hardware -   Target profit data shown at the start and throughout the benchmarking process  â€“ so you can immediately have an indication to your expected profits (3)   Housekeeping features:               - Full screen detection in automatic mode â€“ will not start mining               - Option to remove count-down window               - Debug log does not require re-run

Author: mystere_miner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Why is your BTC exchange rate so high?  I just went to cash out, and checked your exchange rate.  $10 = .00228387, which is an exchange rate of 4378.532928756891.  However, the current exchange rate is $4260.23, that means your exchange rate is almost 3% higher than the actual current exchange rates.  This means we get less BTC than we are due (lower price = more BTC in the exchange).  At first I thought.. Oh, they must not update the price that often.. except I refreshed the page a few times over a few minutes, and saw the price updating.  So you seem to be updating the price constantly, which means you are deliberately charging a higher exchange rate, which combined with your WinMiner Fee + your flat transaction fee (despite the fact that the actual fee you set the transaction to is much lower) means we're paying something like 7% fees (depending on amount withdrawn).  That's pretty high.   I don't begrudge you making money, but this is a "hidden" fee, and deceptive.  If you're going to charge a premium, then you should make that clear.  I don't think many people realize this when using your service.  That's not even counting the fact that we have no visibility into how you calculate your rewards.  We can see a rate that your application says it's mining at, but we have no idea if this is the actual rate we receive, or if it's an estimation (like NH's miner) with different results on the server side.  Your daily bar chart doesn't do a lot here to give us any view into how we're performing at any given time.  I'm not suggesting you're deliberately deceiving us, but the fact we cannot see what's going on makes it difficult to trust.  At least NiceHash gives you a time-graph of profitability, and you can see where you land at any time during the day.

Author: TeamWinMiner

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: WinMiner base currency is USD. That means that your balance (in USD) is guaranteed and protected from coins fluctuations. To do so, WinMiner exchanges coins mined into USD. When a user wants to withdraw, we take the balance (in USD) and carry out the user withdrawal order, whether a PayPal transfer (in USD) or BTC or ETH (in which case we purchase the coins for the user and make the transfer). When buying ETH or BTC using USD a fee is imposed by the exchange, usually in the form of an exchange rate. Hope this clarifies.  BTW, at the request of our users we are working on adding a feature that will allow users to choose their own base currency - that way a user that wants to be exposed to the volatility of a certain coin and would want to withdraw in that coin could keep his balance in that coin and avoid exchange costs.    That's not even counting the fact that we have no visibility into how you calculate your rewards.  We can see a rate that your application says it's mining at, but we have no idea if this is the actual rate we receive, or if it's an estimation (like NH's miner) with different results on the server side.  Your daily bar chart doesn't do a lot here to give us any view into how we're performing at any given time.  I'm not suggesting you're deliberately deceiving us, but the fact we cannot see what's going on makes it difficult to trust.  At least NiceHash gives you a time-graph of profitability, and you can see where you land at any time during the day. Profit data is provided online, with some delay (between 1 - 2 hrs), at a breakdown of 10 mins. We are working on making the data update more frequently.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: WinMiner was originally built for managing the mining of our own mining farm. It continues to do so today and we keep making it better with our own insight together with the wisdom of our contributing users. This is to say that, our interests here are aligned, we are miners like you are and strive for best overall performance just like you do. We are the first to suffer from inefficiencies if such exist.  Specifically to your points:  (1) Hashrate - is it really constant? The short answer is yes. The more accurate answer is divided into two: (a) Hashrate of a GPU generally has a certain max value, but it does sometimes fall beneath it. It could be for a shorter or longer periods of time and may be the results of overclocking, environmental conditions, operating system, drivers, CPU load (which may have a substantial impact on GPU performace) etc.; and (b) Coins having a DAG, e.g. Ethereum, mean that your hardware hashrate will change every few days (e.g. 5 days in the case of Ethereum). To avoid a situations in which a system performance is based on the wrong hashrate reading, whether the result of a sudden drop or changing DAG, we decided to have the benchmarking run once every 24hrs.  (2) Can all coins based on the same algo be bechmarked by just one coin? The short answer is yes. The more accurate answer is again divided into two: (a) Non ethash coins - bechmarking one coin is sufficient, and that is what we do; and (b) ethash coins (ETH, ETC, EXP, UBQ, MUSIC, DBIX etc.) - benchmarking needs to be done taking into account the DAG size - and that is what we do (here we minimize the need for benchmarking by categorising the coins into groups based on their DAG size and doing benchmarking once for the entire group).  Is there room for further optimization? - definitely Are we working at it? - we sure do.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Thanks for giving WinMiner a go and for sending this important feedback! It will be very helpful if you could send the logs so we can have a deeper look (Help > Send Error Report, and please write your nickname so we can know its you)  Looking at the screenshots it appears you have changed the WinMiner default settings by having your Pentium CPU actively mine. This is really NOT recommended for a rig of multi GPUs, especially with a Pentium CPU. A high load on a CPU, which is what you are probably getting by having it mine, can substantially hurt the performance of any GPU, let alone a rig of 8 GPUs like the one you have.  The trade off between getting an extra very little reward for the CPU mining but paying a dear price on your GPUs mining rewards is bad.  We recommend that you turn CPU mining off and examine the performance again.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Quote from: DaemonSK on September 06, 2017, 10:25:34 AM i second that, if you need screenshots i will provide it, but its same as the one he did Thanks for the great question  Three elements that you need to take into account: (1) Coin prices volatility (2) Coin difficulty (even higher) volatility (3) Switching time between coins  While trying to provide you with the best profits we want to avoid rapid switching between coins that fluctuate aggressively in their attractiveness..  So the dynamic algo of WinMiner takes into account the expected switch time while looking for stability in the attractiveness of a certain coin over the others, before attempting to switch.  Its interesting to see in the feedback we receive that different users have very different taste when it comes to switching - some want it no more frequent than once a day while others want to rapidly switch, the moment an opportunity unveils. We aim for the golden path that maximizes profits for everyone   Perhaps we should be adding some manual customizing capabilities to the switching algo so every user could tailor it to his/her taste - what do you say?

Author: mystere_miner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: WinMiner profits have tanked for the last few days.    I know, Bitcoin is down, industry is down, that's not what i'm talking about.  I'm talking about in relation to other similar services...  When NiceHash is consistently beating you in profits.. and i'm not talking about a small amount, as much as $1/day on a 1080Ti, then something in your methodology is wrong.  I suggest you figure out what's going wrong in the way you're doing things.  As an example, i'm currently making $23/day with NH, it's mining Equihash.  WinMiner wants to mine Etc/Dcr at $18/day.  Hardware: 6 1080Ti's and a 1070  Oh, and according to the Job Decision grid, it claims that it should be mining ZEN for $25/day, but it's not.  (Benchmark was just performed 30 minutes earlier as well, so it was relatively fresh)  Yeah, yeah, I know.. prices change, difficulties and hashrates change.. But this is not an isolated example.  NiceHash used to beat you guys around 50% of the time a few days ago, and 50% of the time you were significantly more profitable.  That has stopped.  I have yet to find a single instance in the last few days where your profitability has exceeded NH (even though the job decision grid claims it should be).  Frequently, you're $3-5 and sometimes as much as $10 less profitable.  And that's not even counting all the lost profit from benchmarking every time I turn around.  Speaking of which, some of those benchmarks run a LONG time.. 20-30 minutes.  That's crazy.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Here is a quick reminder on the optimization logic - Benchmarking is being performed once every 24hrs for all coins Price monitoring is performed continuously so WinMiner can react to sudden price and difficulty changes right away. Fine tuning the threshold for performance difference which justifies an algo switch (and the associated switch time) is something we are striving to optimize

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: We understand your concern, we are working on making the balance update as frequently as we possibly can.  Work done by the miners is being recorded on the WinMiner database as it happens. The processing of this data, the outcome of which is the individual balance metrics, is a heavy process that is now being performed once every hour. This is a typical "growing up pain" that we are working to improve.  Thanks for understanding and for your patience.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: There could be a couple of reasons for such a situation - hardware differences (e.g. even GPUs of the same model probably differ on their ASIC quality), OS and drivers differences (no two installations are the same) computer state during the benchmarking could be different, and more.. its really hard to say without thoroughly examining the case.  If you would like to overwrite the WinMiner optimization logic you can simply force WinMiner to mine the coins you want it to - so in your case you can simply choose only KRB if you so wish, though this is not recommended as coins attractiveness and availability for mining changes rapidly (e.g. SIGT block size halved and will soon cease being POW, DMD in 10 days will cease to be POW, etc..)

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: For privacy reasons, the balance is shown on the WinMiner window only after you enter your password. Please enter password and let us know if you encounter any issues.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Thanks for sending the logs.  It seems you are using virtual machines for the mining. This is really not recommended. When the WinMiner software does not find shares for some time it restarts the miner, if this persists, the system identifies the miner as bad and ceases to use this miner. Using a virtual machine significantly increases the likelihood of such a scenario due to the weaker performance of the VM.   Performance from a host machine will be better than the performance of the VM running on it.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Thank you so much for taking the time to review and test WinMiner and to send us such a detailed and well thought list of issues, requests and ideas.  We take great joy when something we create is being so warmly embraced and even more so receiving great feedback, the warm words of support, but no less, the wise advises, ideas, bugs to be fixed â€“ you guys are our rock stars!  (1) Profitability ideas:       - We continue working on the switching mechanism in an effort to optimise its performance.       - We know there is still room for performance optimization - but 70% difference in performance sounds more like a bug - please send us logs so we can take a look       - Your ideas are great and we surely explore them further in our continuous effort for max profits. (2) Watchdog       - WinMiner_service is a watchdog   (3) Auto update       - We might add an option to disable auto update BUT even then some updates will have to be automatic and mandatory - e.g. when client-server protocol changes mining will not be possible without an update.. (4) Intensity settings per each miner       - That would be cool. This would probably take the form of adding an additional command line for each miner/algo. The thing is that at the moment the command line for each miner may take a totally different form which is not convenient.. We are thinking on how to solve this in the best way. Stay tuned.. (5) Cleaning WinMiner icons in tray       - Dev team is looking into this. Thanks for reporting. (6) Live dashboard, required refresh       - Work on getting this page to perform as we want it to is still in progress...sorry for the inconvenience...we will get it right    In the meantime you may want to wait a bit before refreshing, sometimes it takes a few seconds for the data to flow.. (7) Additional coins       - We are adding coins all the time and we have noted your request for FTC and SIB. Keep in mind that due to the one click nature of WinMiner adding a coin means apart from the right miner, the right configuration etc. also the entire food chain that follows including the exchange handling etc. but hey, we never complain about hard work     (8 ) No job on server for XMR       - Please send logs (and make sure "enable debug log" option is checked) so we can nail this down. (9) Live dashboard â€“ removing miner does not work       - Noted. Thanks for reporting. On dev team to do list.. (10) Exit â€“ yet service is still running       - This is not a bug, it is the watchdog which is a Windows service aimed at bringing the main WinMiner app to life if for any reason it crashes or is unresponsive for any reason. It should not be taking up any resources, and being in the background waiting for the moment WinMiner is launched means the best possible watchdog performance.  Great points! Great effort! keep on sending!

Body: I just made a withdraw of 50$  Amount: 50$ = 0.1249452 ETH   (NOT really,  0.1249452 - 47.7 USD at the time of withdraw), 1 ETH was 382.05 USD, you used 1 ETH -> 400 USD exchange rate WinMiner fees: 0.00374835 ETH Transaction fees: 0.0005 ETH Total: 0.12069685 ETH    (46.16 USD)   So i lost 8% in fees  8% is just to mutch...  And i cant believe that exchange,and transfer fees are 5%....

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Thanks for the info - it is very helpful.  We have released a second performance boost to Skunk (SIGT) for high end cards - will be happy to hear if you are now getting the performance you were looking for

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: WinMiner base currency is USD. That means that your balance (in USD) is guaranteed and protected from coins fluctuations. To do so, WinMiner exchanges coins mined into USD.  When a user wants to withdraw, we take the balance (in USD) and carry out the user withdrawal order, whether a PayPal transfer (in USD) or BTC or ETH (in which case we purchase the coins for the user and make the transfer).  When buying ETH or BTC using USD a fee is imposed by the exchange, usually in the form of an exchange rate. In your case the exchange rate was ~400USD for ETH by the exchange.  Deducing our fees (3% = 1.5USD) and the ETH transfer fees (~0.2USD - you can verify that looking at the block explorer for your ETH transfer) from 50USD brings your net to ~48.3USD.  ~48.30USD would buy you 0.12069685 ETH at the exchange and this is the amount we transferred to you.  Hope this clarifies.  BTW, at the request of our users we are working on adding a feature that will allow users to choose their own base currency - that way a user that wants to be exposed to the volatility of a certain coin and would want to withdraw in that coin could keep his balance in that coin and avoid exchange costs.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Integrated GPUs are widely considered not worthwhile for mining on different levels. Perhaps that would change with new mining algos at which stage we will be happy to take another look

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Sorry for that - This issue arises from the lack of standardization in the method of numbering GPUs. Different miners use different numbering methodology....Nevertheless we are working to fix that.  You should note, though, that the reported metrics are correct, even though they may be switched between the GPUs.

Author: Calrornds
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Hi:  I have started using your combo program (dashboard, revenue analyzer, switcher, miners, pool, & exchange  ) a couple of days ago, so far it has been an exciting experience, it's good, a lot of future, I would like to understand a little better how it works, and I will report a couple of problems I have had.  I have been trying it on my Gaming PC/Part Time Miner, Core i5-7500+RX580 8GB+RX560 4GB, I could use it on my mining Rigs, and recommend it to my Gaming Community, but I need to solve the following.  First my doubts: - How do you calculate the revenue per day and I guess the currently mined coin?, I mean, do you consider the current price?, do you sell the coins at that price upon reaching certain amount?/or time?.  Problems: - Only minor ones now, major ones got solved before I finished this message. - WinMIner.com Live Dashboard got offline message if not used after a while, I have to open again the window from the program. - GPUs do not start to work in some occasions, they stay idle when restarted after stopping the mining process to do some other thing, I will try to get the cause and report back.  Ideas: - As some have already suggested, dcri control and voltage control are critical, my RX580 needs a 38 dcri and my RX560 a 24 dcri, so they are not working at their best now while mining EXP. - I usually undervolt my cards on the Miner, now I am using AB with WinMiner, with the RX580 the OC is ok, the undervolt only reachs -96mV, so its running hot or/and noisy now, the RX560 is not usually a problem as it doesn't consume too much power, but it can not be undervolted on AB and if OC it never reaches the specified clocks, so I got only 2 MH/s, maybe a driver, AB version, etc., problem, but anyway, it could be great to add a way to control dcri, voltage and clocks in WinMiner, obviously while keeping it friendly for any casual Miner/Gamer.  Great work, keep at it,  Carlos  PS: Add Komodo as coin, it is killing it right now.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Welcome aboard! (1) Compliments - Thank you very much. It is a A LOT of work but its so rewarding with such great users and feedback   (2) Doubts - WinMiner is all about simplicity and accessibility - to accomplish that we set its base currency to USD, and we exchange coins found to USD to make sure a balance displayed is guaranteed and not subject to fluctuations. Following users requests we are planning on allowing users to set a different base currency of their choice.  (3) Problems -       - Glad to hear that the major ones are history       - Dashboard going offline after a while - we will definitely look into this       - GPUs idle in certain occasions - please provide more info of when and how this happens so we can better address it.  (4) Ideas -       - dcri, voltage control and AB per GPU - we are giving some serious thoughts on how to give more control to those who wish to custom the experience and performance.  Hope this addresses the points.  Thanks again for your support and feedback!

Author: _Dejan_
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: I test your WinMiner apllication around 2 weeks... I like active developement on your product and support... But it need some improvement in few things... 1.) REQUEST: Profitability switching isn't good enought. For example if I mine single coin(XMR) all day I earn around 20-70% more $ per day compared to automatic option... Coin swithcing is done to fast and this lead to losing money, because miner start mining and then switch to other coin... There must be done some application options like: -General coin option(For all coins) to set periodic benchmarking. For example checkbox for automatic(your logic) or custom(user can configure timeout in minutes/hours). For me 1x per day is enought. -General coin option(For all coins) to set periodic profitability check(Check which coin profit is best). For example checkbox for automatic(your logic) or custom(user can configure timeout in minutes/hours). For me 1x per 2/4 hours is enought. -General coin option(For all coins) to set profitability current/average of coin. For example checkbox for current(check which coin is curently best profitable by price, difficulty...) or average. On average must be two options automatic(your logic) or custom(user can configure hours/days which are used to calculate average of coin profitability). -General coin option(For all coins) to set minimum difference in coin price beetwen old mining coin and new minning coin to switchower. For example checkbox for automatic(your logic) or custom(user can configure earning price difference in currency which have selected in settings  example 1.50 USD).  2.) BUG: I see that service WinMiner_Service stop sometime(version 1.74x maybe this is fixed in 1.75 it is to soon to tell)... Maybe add some watchdog to check if service is running and start/restart it if not running but must running...  3.) REQUEST: Option to disable automatic update  4.) REQUEST: Settings for EACH coin miner intensity settings. For example checkbox for automatic(your logic) or custom(user set for XMR Intensity=18 all other are auto)  5.) BUG: WinMiner update, kill WinMiner but leave icon in tray. You need to clean them else there are a lot of WinMiner icons...  6.) BUG: Live statistic usualy need refresh on first open to show data of miners.  7.) Add some other coins like FTC, SIB ...  8.) BUG: When I have enabled mining oly XMR coin sometime I receive message that there is no job from server...  9.) BUG: Live statistic - Removing Miner do not work. It show "Please wait" and then is remove button back. Logout/Login do not help.  10.) BUG Whe exit application(Tray icon is also removed) Service still running.

It (the app) stopped reporting hashrate but was still using my CPUs as if it were running at 100%. And the "Live" page showed no hashrate running for my account. Deleting app for now. Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Really sorry for your inconvenience, would be great if you can send us the logs so we can get to the bottom of this and fix. Without the logs itâ€™s really hard to put a finger on the possible cause (dual CPU or operating system compatibility could be on the list to name a few..), were you mining in â€œall coinsâ€ mode or did you choose specific coins?  What happens when WinMiner is down We have built WinMiner in a way that in a case it ceases to operate (e.g. a crash) for whatever reason, the miners can continue to work and they do so for the benefit of the user. Therefore, in the situation you described, your CPU was working to increase your profits even though WinMiner was not running. (BTW You donâ€™t have to take our word for it, you can simply run a test, kill WInMiner, then let the miners continue to work and check the balance after 10 minutes)  Live dashboard This was released a few days ago and like any infant has to walk before it can run J That means that there are still issues in its operation and sometimes it may report an online rig as being offline. We are ironing out the issues with the dashboard but in the meantime, when in doubt check the WinMiner app window for the real data.   Admin mode Some miners require admin mode to be run effectively, so to get best performance we recommend running WinMiner in admin mode.  Hope this addresses your questions and concerns - let us know if you need further clarifications.  Looking forward to having you back on WinMiner

Author: thaskunk
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Sure thing - Since I use EVGA Precision or MSI Afterburner depending on which brand of card I'm running, I'll simply stick with MSI-A for this example (The process is identical for each utility).  1) Start MSI-A and set clock/core/power/fan settings. I use a saved profile for this. 2) When WinMiner starts actively mining, it wipes out my configuration 3) The configuration in MSI-A actually remains, but I cannot re-apply without a small change, so I make the small change and re-apply. 4) Winiminer changes miners/coins/etc - I make the small change and re-apply as in #3.  If there were a way to automate this process of setting the frequency/clock/etc from the command line I could have it change out every minute and simply alternate between 81-82% power and be happy about it (this wouldn't really give it enough time to get super hot or out of sync, but it does seem that some of the applications do support options for power settings (Specifically Claymore).  When running MSI-A/EVGA-P, the 'monitor' window and the temperature is what I'm using to indicate that my settings are simply not being held on to, despite the window of the system not being appropriately adjusted as well.  If you'd like for me to set up a screen sharing session to demonstrate this to your team, please ask them to respond to my support request and I'll happily do so. It only takes about 2 minutes to demonstrate this.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Choose your WinMiner base currency feature - this is in the works, though no ETA for this, as of now. We know many want this feature so we will do our best to push it forward quickly.  Benchmarking - HW change is definitely a reason for a benchmark re-run, BUT it is NOT the only reason for it - for example there are algos in which the Hash changes over time because of DAG (e.g. Ethereum) or due to skewed previous benchmark results (e.g. due to something else running on the machine at the time of test or numerous other reasons). So we believe it is better to run benchmarking for every coin that was not is session in the last 24H  Ration between coins - this is being tested during benchmark for pre set different ratios of pairs of coins  Hope this clarifies

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Thanks for using WinMiner and for the important question.  The short answer is that WinMiner base currency is USD and therefore the balance that you see (in USD) is protected. No matter what happens to the coin you mined, goes up or crashes down, the balance remains.   The longer answer is that the Winminer premise is  "make it simple" (one click is all it takes - it will analyze your hardware, bring the best miner software, dynamically decide whats best to mine at every single moment, collect the money, and hand it over to you) but just as important is reliability and trustworthiness - that is why we chose to make USD the base currency of WinMiner - so that when you see the balance amount in WinMiner you can be sure that this is your true balance and not something that can shrink tomorrow with a coin price drop.  Having said that, at the request of WinMiner users on this forum, to whom we are grateful, we are working on adding the ability for each user to choose a different base currency for himself - so stay tuned

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization

Alpha users - We love you guys and we are committed to show our love in more measurable ways than just words.. Stay tuned..

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Thanks for using WinMiner and for the feedback. WinMiner base currency is USD, that means that the balance you see in your account is guaranteed against fluctuations in price of digital coins. For this purpose we keep your balance in USD. When you choose a method in which you wish to withdraw your funds we take the balance (in USD) and make the required actions needed to enable the withdrawal. In the case of a BTC withdrawal we need to exchange the USD amount into BTC this exchange entails a fee that in many cases does not come in the form of a "fee" but rather embedded in the exchange rate.  At the request of our users, we are now working on adding a feature that will allow users to choose the base currency of WinMiner, that way, you will be able, if you so wish, to keep your balance in BTC and withdraw in BTC without exchange fees.  Hope this clarifies

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Welcome aboard!  Thank you for choosing WinMiner and for your support! "Device detected" is an early stage in benchmarking in which WinMiner identifies the hardware and prepares for the benchmark testing steps by fetching the right miners, drivers etc.  The length of this stage depends largely on the type of coin, the Algo to be used and the available hardware, and can range from a couple of seconds to several minutes. If on your machine the device detected stage takes more than 6 minutes or so, then please let us know and we will work with you to resolve the issue.  Happy mining

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: UPDATE: payment confirmation times on the Bitcoin network seem to be back to normal (August 17) ******  Payment confirmations on the Bitcoin network are extremely slow due to Bitcoin Network loads  Since July the Bitcoin network is experiencing heavy load causing a surge in the number of unconfirmed transactions, this became even more painful since August 14th (we have seen transactions being delayed by the Bitcoin network for over 48 hours now)... See the graph of unconfirmed transactions here - https://jochen-hoenicke.de/queue/#30d  .  The load on the Bitcoin network causes transactions with low transactions fees to be pushed back on the queue and high transaction fee deals get prioritized. As a result WinMiner withdrawals in BTC (which are using a relatively low transaction fee) take longer than usual to confirm.  Any WinMiner withdrawal transaction made and not yet confirmed can be seen by searching for the transaction number on sites like https://blockchain.info/ .    Such transaction will be confirmed as the load on the Bitcoin network eases up. There is nothing we can do to speed this up or cancel the transaction â€“ these are the rules and the nature of the Bitcoin network.  To assist users who insist on Bitcoin withdrawals and are willing to pay a higher transfer fee (which will put the transaction in high priority and shorten the expected confirm time) we are working on offering an option to opt into a fast, high commission transaction.  So what does that mean to you:  If you already made a withdrawal in Bitcoin and it is still unconfirmed â€“ Patience is the only remedy.  If you are about to make a withdrawal you should consider the following: 1.   Withdrawal in ETH gets a much faster confirmation 2.   Withdrawals in BTC: - Make a withdrawal and wait for the network confirmation - Wait for the high transfer fee and priority solution - Write to support[at]winminer.com and ask for a manual BTC withdrawal using high transfer fee. 3.   Withdraw using one of the other payment methods â€“ e.g. PayPal  Hope this helps

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Ok, we went over the logs   First, a couple of words on how WinMiner optimizes profits and on the volatile environment we all operate in â€“  (1)    Volatility â€“ the two major factors affecting the profit shown per coin is (i) price and (ii) mining difficulty. Both are very volatile (especially the difficulty in certain coins e.g. SIGT â€“ which is one of the coins you were mining per the logs). To understand the magnitude of volatility we would just say that seeing the profit drop by 80% and/or double within a minute is not uncommon. This alone could explain switching to a lower profit coin, so if mining is at, letâ€™s say, 3$/day one minute and the next minute due to surging difficulty the very same coin would profit just 1.5$/day, then switching to the next best coin at 2.4$/day would be the right thing to do.  But there is more  ..  (2)    Benchmarking â€“ testing of all mining options is fundamental. In WinMiner we introduced a next generation benchmarking, called Express, which incorporates crowd wisdom while also enjoying the full benefits of all options benchmarking to achieve great performance out of the box. We do that by testing the top performing options, based on other users work choice on similar machines, and then periodically (every 30 mins) test another option until all options are tested (we of course continue price monitoring and benchmarking continuously).  Your logs show that you were on Express benchmarking (which is the default) which could explain a quick benchmark option test every 30 mins or so until benchmarking is complete.  Lastly, we are working to enhance our nVidia miners and profit options. The same optimization algo would max profits for both AMD users and nVidia users in the same way, so without a significant benefit creating separate versions for AMD users and for nVidia users is probably just more overhead..  Sorry for the lengthy responseâ€¦we wanted you to have all the info..  Thanks for using WinMiner, for the warm words and keep on sending feedback.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Thank you for the warm words   Thank you so much for taking the time to write the very important feedback, we especially appreciate your efforts in doing so not in your native tongue.  First let us start by saying that we want WinMiner to be the product of choice for any card type owner â€“ so here is to all the â€œnotsobadâ€ card owners out there â€“ we are here for you!  Sgminer issue â€“ mining Bitcoin is for a long time not feasible on hardware which is not dedicated for Bitcoin. The issue we have had with the coin DMD is now resolved.  Your comment re fluctuating profit metrics is a great opportunity to understand one of the great advantages of WinMiner. But first lets clarify a very important point â€“ WinMiner was created to, and indeed manages our rig farm machines therefore you can rest assured the numbers you see on WinMiner are real and reflect real time data. We do not make up numbers. The cause of fluctuating metrics is real time changes in the difficulty metric and the coin price metric. If you study these metrics for KRB as an example you will understand how intense the volatility is for this coin. Now we get to the cool part, with WinMiner you can ride the waves of such volatility to max your profits (you are welcome to see the live comparison here  https://www.screenleap.com/winminer) â€“ WinMiner continuously monitors and takes advantage of this volatility for your benefit. You can always decide to avoid coins with high volatility by unchecking them on your settings screen, but then again why not enjoy the extra profit? Anyway the steering wheel is in your hands..   We work hard to make WinMiner do all the hard work for us and for you, but there is one thing it can not, and no one else can do, and that is visibility into the future. No one knows what the difficulty and prices of coins will be in the next 10 seconds let alone in the next month, so unfortunately there is no way to guarantee the rate of return on your hardware investment. You simply have to make a decision whether you jump in knowing there is zero visibility. If its of any comfort, you are not alone in this dilemma, yet we think it will be fare to say that to this date we doubt if anyone regrets jumping in, the real regret is probably not jumping in with a mightier computing powerâ€¦ but then again this is not a recommendation to buy or not to buy hardware. If you do jump in, we believe you will be very happy running WinMiner on your rig and so will we.   Finally, your comment on the user interface is noted, we are considering how to do that without overloading the screen with too much confusing data. Stay tuned.  Hope this clarifies.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Welcome on board! and thanks for your support and kind words.   However, there's room for improvement. Even greater thanks for sending us the important feedback that can help us become better every day.   Firstly, it seems quite inconsistent with how it calculates earnings - like the guy above me said.... It seems that WinMiner fluctuates A LOT with mining XMR for $.30 a day to KRB for $.70 a day. How come? Is this due to the currencies changing in value so frequently or what?...  Is it possible that the currency is changing in value so quickly and so frequently?  (1) Winminer reports only true and real numbers. (2) Certain coins experience high fluctuations in price as well as mining difficulty e.g. KRB (3) WinMiner takes advantage of price and difficulty fluctuations to max profits (4) You can choose to avoid coins with high fluctuations and enjoy more stable, yet lower, profits. Please look at our full response to this matter - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2004875.msg20711549#msg20711549   Also, I am doing CPU mining, so I will only have CPUs selected to do mining and not GPUs. However, even with the on board GPU displayed in the Available mining devices and unselected, it still says Mining: KRB @ xxxh/s = $$$ - and it's the exact same number as the above CPUs. Does that mean it's really using the GPU to mine too, or not? Very confusing. Sounds like a bug :-) Sorry for that. Could you please send us log files? (Help>Send error reports, make sure "send log files" is checked, and please write your nickname so we can know its from you) This will really help us track it down quickly.   I am mining through a VM, so was wondering what the best config for CPU would be - how to configure the CPU bit? Are results likely to be the same if I configure the VM with 1 CPU with 16 cores or 16 separate CPUs with 1 core? This is a great point to clarify - There are a couple of things to remember re virtual machines: (1) the sum of multiple VM instances can not be greater and will almost certainly be lower than the performance of the host machine; (2) A GPU can only be allocated to one "machine, either real or virtual (dont expect to have the GPU allocated to multiple VMs)   Does anyone have experience in whether it's better to use Linux & NiceHash or other apps instead of Windows? I heard it's usually better on Linux but didn't really have that experience, so I'm not sure what to think. My knowledge is limited so it might be that I didn't configure something properly :'D . Linux allows for greater creativity in rig buiding - e.g. more GPUs etc. but should not provide different performance vs. Windows.    Also, would it be good to invest in a good GPU to do some mining? If so, what are your recommendations? A good GPU will increase your profits considerably. There are many calculators out there ranking GPUs based on their anticipated return. Just remember that no one knows what will happen to digital coin prices in 10 seconds let alone a month. Read the full response on this matter https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2004875.msg20711549#msg20711549   Why is it when I open Task Manager, CPU utilisation isn't 100% when WinMiner is mining? Great question - it all boils down to the architecture of the CPU and the manner in which the mining algorithm can use it. Some algos utlize specific computing capabilities, some functionalities are per core others per thread, so the fact the CPU consumption is not showing 100% does not mean that the CPU is not giving all it has to the mining of a specific algo.   Keep up the good work guys! We promise to do our best!

Author: olddarkstar
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Dear winminer team & dear miners, just my 1081 $cents I gave winminer a small trial period 8 days with a very light powerd system. : Dual Xeon E5645, 16 gb ram & a single R9 270 (I swaped some cards  the first days: from nvidia quadro 4000 to R9 270x and to R9 270 all worked well) I was always able to work on the system even that it was configured as allways on in farm mode. only watching youtube  broke system performance.  my first resume is : Wow t y it worked well. The winminer team is quick in bug fixing and tries to make a dummy proof simple and easy to use service. after 8 days i saw the minimum withdraw ballance that is 10$ via btc other than noted on the website (5$).  I thought to test such a service it needs to proof if it realy gives me a profit. The ballance was 10.81$ and after i saw the conversion rate I nearly fainted :  Amount: 10.81$ = 0.00306605 BTC WinMiner fees: 0.00009198 BTC Transaction fees: 0.0001 BTC Total: 0.00287407 BTC  The actual course per btc was about 3.359,2096 $ that time  but anyhow it is a great service just installing a very easy to use  software and getting btc or USD via paypal without any further knowlledege or much todo`s.  some other points that I like to share: security: this software could possibly kill your system software or leak other data on your system because running as admin. better use it on mining only systems. transparency: I would like to know whom to trust that much.  my requests for enhancemd and wishes are more transparency, more and better withdraw possibillities, more stats and infos on the webpage (as you wrote before you like to keep the software interface clean), a run minimized or run as service option, the previously anounced portable version, the possibility to set temperature and fan limits (gpu temps over 80Â°C are not healthy for my gpu`s)  maybe a bug: it shows both CPUS with mining.. and a total for each CPU but only counts one. since  i have abut 50% systemload the  count of only one cpu is ok but it leads to wrong expectations.  while writing this I am still waiting for the  btc`s to arrive at my wallet but my sytem generated 0.13$ again (english is not my native language ;-) )

Author: taosk8r
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Posted this on your reddit thread, but idk that you are watching it, clear you are watching this, so:  First off, Im super impressed. Ive been looking for something similar to NH/MG in terms of interface, and this really nails it! Im really new to all this, and although its featureset is impressive (especially the ability to use an alternative to coinwarz to determine profitability - I think the dream would be something that would average profitability math across multiple sites), I have found that something like Awesome miner is just too much to configure for someone like me who is small scale enough to where 40 cents a day is good profits, lol.  Possible bug: I configured it not to run at startup in the options, but it still ran (edit I see another report here).  Feature requests : on the website graph show which coins were mined on hover on the bars would be awesome. Would also be nice if I could see what various coins I mined and my total holding in those individual coins. I would also really like something like an autoconverting payout in selected coins like prohashing if that could eventually be managed (so far that feature is unique to them afaik).  IDK if there is an option to report GPU temps from the miners that show them, and account for that information when determining profitability (because it has to stop mining for a few cycles when it goes over 90 degrees), but there is one miner that constantly overheats my GPU, and Id like to have some way to determine which one that is so I can disable it without watching every window that pops up like a hawk.  Really looking forward to the promised more CUDA miners, and although it isnt a super priority for me as Im not currently using other computers, I think a portable option (unzip and run) would be kinda cool in addition to that other guy.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: WinMiner's latest version offers two modes of benchmarking, the default one, called express, uses crowd wisdom to quickly set each device to work on what is probably the most profitable coin for it, it then goes on every 30 mins or so to test additional coin at a time until it finishes a whole cycle of benchmarking. It then begins monitoring for best performance. In this mode you get up and running quickly with great performance while making sure your machine is fully optimized at the end of the process. The second mode is a traditional full cycle benchmarking which tries out all options until a winner is found and then monitors for making sure you are always optimized. You are welcome to choose which one suits you better - express is the default mode and can be turned off by unchecking it in the settings screen (which will activate the traditional benchmarking) Hope this clarifies

IDK if there is an option to report GPU temps from the miners that show them, and account for that information when determining profitability (because it has to stop mining for a few cycles when it goes over 90 degrees), but there is one miner that constantly overheats my GPU, and Id like to have some way to determine which one that is so I can disable it without watching every window that pops up like a hawk.
