I think a portable option (unzip and run) would be kinda cool in addition to that other guy. This is still on schedule for this week. Stay tuned

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Thanks for reaching out. The email address is critical for the operation of WinMiner since the owner of the email address is the owner of the profits generated by WInMiner. That is why we have added an extra step in which users, after registering receive an email asking them to click on a validation link. This way both us and you can be sure that no mistake was made in entering the email address. Please click the validation link in the email you received from us and shortly thereafter your balance will show on the account. Sorry for the inconvenience with the correspondence with our support - we will look into this. Linux version - sorry but currently we have no plans for it. We hope you will enjoy WinMiner  Let us know if you encounter any issues.

Author: LeBibliothecaire
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Greetings to all the people behind WinMiner, and all who read this.  First of all, I'd like to say 'thank you', it's been a good 20 days aboard (mostly good), thank you for the product and all that you have done so far. We, the guys with 2GB VGA memory "notsobad" cards ( ), or those with second to none technical skills with miners (I guess), do appreciate the existence of your creation. As you get small part of our computational work - this is happy relationship and I hope it will be more so. This it why I am writing. There are some questions I'd like to address, feel free to respond or ignore me, I mean no ones harm, please forgive my English, it is not my native and not as good as I like it to be, if I offend with some words or misuse them - sorry in advance. Oh - and there are some pictures too. So...  1. sgminer and unrecognized option and all things already said here - will not repeat, but it will be great. Back in the days when bitcoins was so easily mined and dwell in between 5 and 20$ and was sold for that   - I've had some pretty good results with sgminer. Pretty consistent. Yes - consistensy, onward...  2. The estimated profit numbers - ALL over the place for me. With many miners and coins. And winminer is looking me in the eyes and tells me lies. May be it is just me, but I do have 2 monitors and keep an eye on both Winminer GUI and miner command prompt window while reading - the hashrate stays (relatively) constant, but even on 1 session - the expected reward swings sometimes 300% back and forth and back again. Most of the time more like 50 to 100%, which is irritating enough, so to want to do something about it. Is it from the miner, is it from the pool, is it from me, should i move to other miner, what can I do...? The picture below shows mining KRB in 18 minutes time - same hashrate, once it is showing 1.90$/day profit, after a very short while - 1.01$/day. Then back up again. And have seen like 0.60$/day. In a matter of minutes. Why? What number is the real number I get. How can i make decision on what to mine with what to mine if I don't have proper information. Should I take it off the list of currencies i mine? How can I take it off if it is my "best" coin? What is then my best coin? BTW showing KRB as experiencing largest fluctuations of numbers shown with it. There are more currencies with similar behavior. Today I looked around some mining calculators around the net and putting in my hardware i get like 0.44$/day with KRB. Not that will complain if you give me, like 1.20$/day for something that costs 0.44$/day, but it is not good, generally speaking, and if it is showing 1.20 and I get 0.44 is ... well, not good. You get my point.  First image is from 03.08.2017, when i start thinking about writing you about this, so made some screenshots, to back up my words. http://imgur.com/a/vxAB9  And 3 hours ago, still auto on choosing what/where/with what to mine http://imgur.com/a/pIBJ9  3. I know you guys work on this hard, and I see progress and things added, refined and polished. I salute you for your work. But some things are rough. Basic ones. Look at the picture below. It is me, spontaneously zooming my days work, random day, on the website, 'Statistics' tab, 12 hours interval, took the same 03.08.2017 for example, but when scroll back and forth it's more or less the same every day. "The WinMiner software analyzes each systems and automatically determines which miner to use and which coin to mine .... in order to maximize the return." . Well, it tries. But sometimes misses I guess. I have not been on the computer at this time. The bar interval is 10 minutes, as it illustrates better (I think). And for those using speech engines tired of reading will sum it up - there are HUGE differences in profit, from 0.00087$ in 10 minutes, trough 0.009$ in 10 minutes, to 0.015$ in 10 minutes (for faster readers - count the zeros). The difference (for 10 minutes work in 6 hours interval) is 17.35 times. Or in percentage - 1735%. Bit of a scary number. This cannot be explained with the program bench-marking, the internet gone, or the price of the specific coin up or down. If the pool we're connected goes off I've seen winminer starting again, so it is not that too. http://imgur.com/a/19BWo  For me - it's the program choosing not the best job there is. Or it is an issue connected with the one I spoke earlier (p.2). That goes again choosing not the best job there is and so on and on...  4. Here is another, this time suggestion, I think no one have mentioned it and can be pretty useful. It can resolve partially at least (or for the most part) "numbers" and "consistency" deviations. And can be beneficial to us all. The program (winminer) does collect data while it works. It's on the statistics page on the website. I doubt that is all from the logs. Or that it can be all from logs. So it is possible to collect, and split up, and visualize for a given period of time "anyone's" specific hardware configuration's work. For the day, may be better I think, or whatever suits you. For that period for  - what WAS the most profitable coin, or miner, or coin/miner duo that have worked on YOUR machine. With something visual, like bars with numbers, horizontal with different length, for a fair (statistically) amount of time. Like "for the last 24 hours you've had  X, Y, Z coins mined (with corresponding miner, and/or any other info) AND for that 24 hours you have mined coin X at rate 0.0065$ per 10 minutes, coin Y at rate 0.0059$ per 10 minutes, coin Z... etc. You get it? I will not post a picture of 'stacked bar chart'   , if someone needs one - Microsoft Word / Insert menu/ Charts or google it. This way one can decide for real what is more profitable for his hardware to mine. For that moment in time, at least. Because honestly - I never got those 2.22$/day from the second picture. Nor the 1.57$/day.  The reason writing for the last more than hour is - now I have my machine, and for 20 hours per day it does nothing, and I am using it with WinMiner. Since the ETH became... well... hard to mine - there are a lot of nice not so expensive 2GB VGA cards around me, if I am able to evaluate the possible profit of a card with WinMiner I can build relatively inexpensive rig and give it a go. WinMiner is a very welcome option for me, esp. with the ability to choose what to mine with what miner to mine, backups are awesome, but all in the end for me goes to simple calculation - if I invest thousands of $$ in 8 cards rig it will mater how fast those come back. It will no longer be a matter of 1.20 or 1.50$/day But I need reliable Winminer for that.   Well, you said "help and feedback". This is me, helping and feed-backing. Good night all. With ClathmoreDualEthBlake on R9 270X at the moment - signing off.

Author: pacman88
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: My first post here!  I just recently started researching and exploring the world of crypto currencies and stumbled upon WinMiner. Been using it for a few days now and it's a great idea! Very easy to use, super simple, which is I guess what you were going for. However, there's room for improvement. Firstly, it seems quite inconsistent with how it calculates earnings - like the guy above me said. Also, I am doing CPU mining, so I will only have CPUs selected to do mining and not GPUs. However, even with the on board GPU displayed in the Available mining devices and unselected, it still says Mining: KRB @ xxxh/s = $$$ - and it's the exact same number as the above CPUs. Does that mean it's really using the GPU to mine too, or not? Very confusing. I am mining through a VM, so was wondering what the best config for CPU would be - how to configure the CPU bit? Are results likely to be the same if I configure the VM with 1 CPU with 16 cores or 16 separate CPUs with 1 core?  Does anyone have experience in whether it's better to use Linux & NiceHash or other apps instead of Windows? I heard it's usually better on Linux but didn't really have that experience, so I'm not sure what to think. My knowledge is limited so it might be that I didn't configure something properly :'D .  It seems that WinMiner fluctuates A LOT with mining XMR for $.30 a day to KRB for $.70 a day. How come? Is this due to the currencies changing in value so frequently or what? Obviously it's better if I mine KRB for $.70 per day than XMR for $.30 a day. But WinMiner changes between them automatically and when I want to put it back to KRB manually, I get a tiny number like $.20 - even though it was showing $.70 just a moment ago? Is it possible that the currency is changing in value so quickly and so frequently?  Also, would it be good to invest in a good GPU to do some mining? If so, what are your recommendations?  Keep up the good work guys!  Thanks (y)  EDIT: One more thing I noticed - Why is it when I open Task Manager, CPU utilisation isn't 100% when WinMiner is mining? Most computers show around 50% CPU utilisation and only one of computers is showing around 80% CPU utilisation by NsCPUCNMiner64.exe. All of them are configured to be in "Farm Mode" mining. Am I right that it should be 100% utilisation or what am I missing? Would appreciate an answer as I want to maximise utilisation on these machines.

Author: pleno_miner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: I have following issues: - infinite benchmarking for ZEC for my 6xGTX1080 rig. - when mining ZEC all hashes in winminer window are equal to the GPU0 hashrate while in the console the hashes Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Thanks everyone for the wise tips, great feature ideas and for the bug reports. We listen and learn   We have been working on a couple of things which bothered some of you and are happy to inform that we just released an update with the following improvements:  (1) Express Benchmarking - WinMiner now offers a new benchmarking method called Express (on top of existing benchmarking) - the express, which is now the default benchmarking method, leverages crowd wisdom to get you up and running quickly with great results while making sure your profits are optimized. It does so by testing a couple of options most likely to give you best profits (based on results from others with similar hardware). Then, once in a while, it will make an additional attempt at a time until a thorough benchmarking is complete.  (2) Express benchmarking stop checkbox has been added - so you can make the express benchmarking stop (and the old benchmarking will then commence), with a click, if you so desire  (3) Turning off a specific miner - you asked for it. it is now enabled.  (4) Wrong hash rate display for nVidia cards - we believe we have nailed this one down.  (5) Nvidia cards looping benchmark - we think this one is history.  This is it for now, more things in the pipeline (e.g. more miners for cuda)   We canâ€™t wait to hear if we have solved a problem you have experienced or if you like the changes we have made.

Author: Posty2k3
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: I've been using WinMiner for a few days, and so far it's been pretty great. The payouts have been much better than Nicehash for my systems. However, I've been running into some issues with my main gaming rig that has two GTX 980s in it. A couple of issues with how WinMiner is reporting the hash rates compared to what I'm seeing in the console window, as well as continual benchmarking.  For example, when mining ZEC, the console window shows GPU0 at 317 h/s, and GPU1 at 340 h/s. However, the WinMiner GUI shows both GPUs at 317 h/s. I don't know if this is effecting the actual payout rate for the other GPU, but it's strange that it's not reporting properly.  Another issue I've been having is with EthMinerCuda. Before that was enabled, the benchmarks cleared fine and WinMiner was properly selecting the correct algorithm based on payout. However, WinMiner seems to be stuck in a constant loop of benchmarking with EthMinerCuda. It ran for over almost 24 hours and never switched off to another miner to benchmark. In addition, the hash rate is being reported completely incorrectly with that miner. Each GTX 980 should be getting around 22 Mh/s, for a total of 44 Mh/s. However, WinMiner is reporting each GPU running at 44 Mh/s, which is completely incorrect.  I was wondering if there might be a way to disable specific mining software if we don't want to use it. I know that we're able to disable certain coins, however that doesn't help out when there's both EthMinerCuda and Claymore for Ethereum. For me, the hash rate was no different between EthMinerCuda or Claymore in Ethereum-only mode.  Previously, WinMiner was typically running any combination of dual mining modes for a maximum payout and was working great. Now I simply have it set to mine ZEC/ZCL/ZEN/HUSH because I'm getting a better payout out of those than it simply sitting in a loop while benchmarking EthMinerCuda.  Other than that, the program has been great and my payout is still better than what NiceHash was providing. In addition, the program has had absolutely no issues on my R9 280X system (possibly due to EthMinerCuda not even being a possibility on that system as that seems to be the issue on my nvidia system).

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: We can not be more happy..    issues with how WinMiner is reporting the hash rates compared to what I'm seeing in the console window, as well as continual benchmarking....with EthMinerCuda... We have disabled Ethminer on WinMiner for further testing. Thank you for reporting these issues!   I was wondering if there might be a way to disable specific mining software if we don't want to use it. Interesting - will take it up with the team. Thank you.   Other than that, the program has been great and my payout is still better than what NiceHash was providing. In addition, the program has had absolutely no issues on my R9 280X system... Hallelujah

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Seems like Ethminer Cuda was causing a loop of the benchmarking - we have disabled it for further testing. Thank you for reporting this and for sending the log files. Please let us know if this issue is indeed resolved now on your end as well. Sorry for the inconvenience.

Author: universalresonance
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Hello,   I just want to say THANK YOU for at least developing a product and bringing it to the market with options of withdrawing funds into regular accounts.  This is a double edge sword- more people into the market-value might crash difficulty might rise and what not but it's good to have competition.  I will use it and currently using it with my 1080ti- single gpu.  I've tried Minergate- which is not at all optimized Nicehash (restricts us for withdraws to minimum) 0.01 btc on external wallets  Winminer- just started lol  EDIT**  1. If possible an option of getting paid straight up in the currency of the coin we mined ? 2. You do the exchange on your end and we always get paid in BTC ? 3. I assume- when we withdraw that's when the exchange will take place? 4. At bottom I assume, balance is just displayed in USD but wherever this balance is stored-is it in BTC or USD or their respective mined coin and when we press withdraw-the "fund" will be taken out from your reserves and paid to us in however way we choose?  So you basically work like a central bank holding on to all currencies and then at time of withdraw we are given the option of USD or BTC -right?   Another EDIT***  I'm running it and now it's mining ETC ? like why? that's horrible for 1080ti -isn't it suppose to know that or does it learn everything via running one full cycle of everything out there?  Also, BTW all of us Alpha testers- testing this service- are there any benefits or club access per say? - considering some members might be actually sacrificing Dollars from tested systems to test this? Just wondering , for example- since if you test a product for a company they allow you to keep it as a token of gratitude.  Is there something for us Alpha testers? lowers fees for the "seed" members ? or what not?   Another EDIT**  SO I selected the coins I wanted to mine it worked out fine but then all of a sudden it just stopped out of no where- it was still on but stopped mining, I had to select mine "all coins" and then it started working again.   EDIT***  So I had to stop running the software because it would switch coins and kept mining ETH giving me $2 a day -this isn't efficient for 1080ti and when I checked other coins it didn't mine at all

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Much appreciated! Thanks for using WinMiner   1. If possible an option of getting paid straight up in the currency of the coin we mined ? 2. You do the exchange on your end and we always get paid in BTC ? 3. I assume- when we withdraw that's when the exchange will take place? 4. At bottom I assume, balance is just displayed in USD but wherever this balance is stored-is it in BTC or USD or their respective mined coin and when we press withdraw-the "fund" will be taken out from your reserves and paid to us in however way we choose? Great comments and ideas. 1. This is already on our roadmap  2. WinMiner base currency is USD. That means that anything mined is exchanged into USD. If payment is requested in BTC then we exchanged into it. BTW we are considering giving users the option to choose their WinMiner base currency, e.g. have BTC as base currency. Jury is still out on this.. 3. For withdrawals in BTC the answer is yes. 4. The displayed balance in USD is the real balance. Following a BTC withdrawal request the required exchange will take place.  So you basically work like a central bank holding on to all currencies and then at time of withdraw we are given the option of USD or BTC -right?  Central bank is very flattering, thanks  Truth is we simply want to make the whole process easy and accessible to all without losing our pants in the process..   I'm running it and now it's mining ETC ? like why? that's horrible for 1080ti -isn't it suppose to know that or does it learn everything via running one full cycle of everything out there? .......-this isn't efficient for 1080ti 1. Benchmarking cycle - Our benchmark cycle covers all possible options, including specific coins variance. In addition, we continuously optimize in light of changing coins exchange prices and difficulties. 2. 1080 - We are working on improved optimization for 1080 GPUs and will let you know as soon as its live.  Is there something for us Alpha testers? lowers fees for the "seed" members ? or what not? That is a great point that have not escaped us. We are very thankful to all our alpha users and will come up with something to show our gratitude. Stay tuned..  Thank you for the important feedback and for helping us make WinMiner better!

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Thanks for the feedback Benchmark display - we totally agree. We are working on a new design for the benchmark display. Benchmark operation - There are different levels of optimizations happening all the time during the operation of WinMiner. We simply want our users to get the best possible profits. Profit depends on many factors that change all the time and we want WinMiner to be on top of that. Exchange rate optimization happens all the time and hardware hashrate performance takes place every 24h or when algo parameters change e.g. DAG size. That is one of the ways we use to great great profits for our users. So don't worry. We have your back covered  Team WinMiner

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Great question... and No, we are not hiding (we are just working hard on WinMiner..)  In fact we too ask ourselves the same question whenever thinking of using a new app/service.  The short story is that we are the guys behind SpeedBit, the company that invented the most popular download manager - Download Accelerator Plus. We made our first steps in the crypto space sometime ago building our rig shop (we did it again and again - trying to make them more cost effective and with better cooling etc.) and at the same time max our profits from hash power by mining the most profitable coin at any given time. We simply could not find a management software for our rigs that would cut it.. so after months of very hard work we created our own (aka WinMiner). Then we thought why not let everyone enjoy it, so we packaged WinMiner in a way that anyone could easily install and enjoy, but were not sure if people would like it or not so we came to this great community and forum and asked for help and guidance. Since then, we have worked even harder addressing requests, question, improving WinMiner, making sure everything works as it should... and we love every minute of it.. This is a great opportunity to thank everyone on the forum for trying WinMiner and sending us great feedback and support. We are committed to make it even better for you all to enjoy.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SPLENDID WORK

Author: raglin
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: An issue when mining with the Claymore CryptoNote CPU Miner: it's running in the Slow Mode because it needs admin permissions (once). If you set Winminer to show the console you can see this when Claymore starts up.  Additionally, I have a dual CPU system I'm testing this on - I select both CPU's but it's only actually mining on one CPU. Could be a restriction of the Claymore miner though (it does mention all logical CPU's but it's only maxing out one CPU).  Also, for some reason it displays that unselected devices are mining. Ofcourse I'm not selecting my onboard Radeon HD or the Basic Display Adapter, but it claims that it does (the values are the same as the devices that are really mining).

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: WinMiner by default should be run as Administrator (the program title should show "(Administator)") and WinMiner should therefore run Claymore as Admin as well.   Additionally, I have a dual CPU system I'm testing this on - I select both CPU's but it's only actually mining on one CPU. Could be a restriction of the Claymore miner though (it does mention all logical CPU's but it's only maxing out one CPU). Were you able to max out both CPUs using Claymore (not through WinMiner)?   Also, for some reason it displays that unselected devices are mining. Ofcourse I'm not selecting my onboard Radeon HD or the Basic Display Adapter, but it claims that it does (the values are the same as the devices that are really mining). Currently WinMiner does not support partial selection of GPUs. The performance you report seeing for your Basic Display Adapter probably belongs to other GPU on your system and is the result of the lack of standard identification method among miners (an issue we discussed earlier on the thread) which we are working to solve and hope to do so soon.

Wouldn't have known a reboot was needed without bringing up the Claymore window though.   Quote from: raglin on July 15, 2017, 08:50:38 PM Additionally, I have a dual CPU system I'm testing this on - I select both CPU's but it's only actually mining on one CPU. Could be a restriction of the Claymore miner though (it does mention all logical CPU's but it's only maxing out one CPU). Were you able to max out both CPUs using Claymore (not through WinMiner)?  Tested this briefly - by default it does not. Also couldn't find anything specific to allow it to using one mining instance. Easiest way seems to be spawning 2 seperate miners.   Quote from: raglin on July 15, 2017, 08:50:38 PM Also, for some reason it displays that unselected devices are mining. Ofcourse I'm not selecting my onboard Radeon HD or the Basic Display Adapter, but it claims that it does (the values are the same as the devices that are really mining). Currently WinMiner does not support partial selection of GPUs. The performance you report seeing for your Basic Display Adapter probably belongs to other GPU on your system and is the result of the lack of standard identification method among miners (an issue we discussed earlier on the thread) which we are working to solve and hope to do so soon.  Fair enough and I do understand the challenges, but I hadn't selected any GPUs in this case. It was displaying the CPU mining results next to the Basic Display Adapter.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Thank you for raising the economic question  The fee is the easiest part, and it will be updated shortly on the announcement post, as you have requested (WinMiner charges 3%, other fees e.g. miner fees exchange fees payment method fees, if exist , are not included)  Now to the more complex question regarding exchange rates and volatile coins -  The idea behind WinMiner is to max profit for our users and make it super accessible and easy to all. To address the accessibility cause we chose US Dollar as the base currency of WinMiner as this appeals to everyone. That means that the profit rate as well as the balance are shown and held in US Dollars. This way users get visibility and stability to their profits and the coin price speculation part is eliminated. Users will get paid their balance amount even if the price of the coins they mined collapsed. The flip side is also true, so if the coin price goes up their balance is not linked to the coins and will remain the same (just to clear, in the latter case we do not enjoy the price appreciation of the coins either ? there is no conflict of interests between WinMiner and its users ? our interests are always aligned).  Having said that, we are working on adding the capability of changing the balance currency to each users preference this way the balance will be shown in the currencies of choice and the user will be fully exposed to the fluctuations of that currency.  Volatility of coins ? since the balance is held in US Dollars coins get converted to USD continuously so price fluctuations is mitigated. Further, since the dynamic mining algorithm continuously shifts to the most profitable coin, a coin with high volatility and low volume that results in low sale price will immediately lose its attractiveness and hash power will be redirected elsewhere.  Hope this clarifies  One last request from everyone ? we will address all your questions appreciate all your comments and critic ? but at the same time if we are doing something good or if you like what we do then please share that with us as well ? this is the staff that gets us going

Body: Your log file shows that the benchmarking on your machine did not run properly â€“ certain coins were not tested at allâ€¦so the profit numbers you saw were partial and based on limited number of coins only. We need more detailed logs to get to the bottom of this and need your help for this â€“ we have released a new version â€“ 1.61 with enhanced debug log capabilities.  Here is what we need you to do: (1)   Make sure you are using version 1.61 (the update should happen automatically when clicking the â€œStartâ€ button. Look at the top left corner of the WinMiner window to see the version number) (2)   Go to Settings and on the â€œGeneralâ€ tab - check the â€œenable debug logâ€ option (3)   Go to the â€œBenchmark resultsâ€ tab â€“ and press â€œclearâ€ to remove the previous limited benchmark results (4)   Exit WinMiner by clicking right click on the WinMiner icon in the tray and choosing â€œExitâ€ (5)   Run WinMiner, wait for Benchmarking to complete, and send us the logs (Help > Send Error Report)  Thanks for the tips!  Team WinMiner

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Guys, Need your help and feedback.  After months of hard work we think we are ready with our new baby product â€“ WinMiner WinMiner was built to allow anyone, without knowledge of computers, digital coins or technical background to make a buck from their computer when its idle (90% of the time) The WinMiner software analyzes each systems and automatically determines which miner to use and which coin to mine and also serves as a pool in order to maximize the return. It also makes it real easy to receive the payment â€“ getting Bitcoins is of course offered but also getting iTunes gift cards, PayPal and soon pre-paid cards  So the idea was to make it simple, efficient and good for anyone â€“ from a kid and his PC to a guy running a farm All we ask is that you give it a try and let us know what you think and how we can do better.  Windows Downloads: Setup | Portable Linux (test version) Download: contact support@winminer.com  WinMiner website: https://www.winminer.com Telegram channel: https://t.me/teamwinminer Facebook channel: https://www.facebook.com/WinMiner/ Twitter channel: https://twitter.com/TeamWinMiner Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/winminer/ YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFiKPC3zsi0fzk8Hq5rynCQ/ Medium: https://medium.com/@teamwinminer Steemit: https://steemit.com/@teamwinminer  Please be gentle    And, special thanks to Claymore and EWBF for allowing us to use their miners and to the great communities supporting the open source miners Sgminer, Ccminer, Genoil, Cgminer for making such great miners available to all.  WinMiner Team  MAIN FEATURES - Mining multi coins (ETH, ETC, ZEC, VTC, XMR, XVG, ZCL, EXP, UBQ, GRS, HUSH, DCR, MUSIC, DGB, ZEN, SIB, SUMO, ETN, BTCZ, BTG, PIRL, ELLA, HAL, CRC, VIVO, GBX, RVN, RYO, LOKI, ETP, AION, AKA, CLO, TUBE, AEON, ETHO, ZEL, GRFT) - Control which coins to mine - Using leading miners - including Claymore, EWBF and cgminer - Miners always being updated automatically to the latest version - Visibility and control - miners and coins being used/mined - Auto-benchmark - WinMiner tests and decides in real time to switch to the most profitable coin based on real time pricing, difficulty and machine performance - Three operation modes - only mine when computer is idle, manual control, mining farm mode - Show miner window option - Automatic driver installation - Support different cards configuration (CPU, NVIDIA, AMD) - Reporting (on WinMiner website) - Multi withdraw options - BitcoinCash (BCH), Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), litecoin (LTC), PayPal, Payeer, Cryptopia, Coinbase, Steam Gift Cards, Amazon Gift Cards and iTunes Gift Cards (more coming...)  FEES WinMiner charges 3%, other fees e.g. miner fees exchange fees payment method fees, if exist, are not included.  ======================  VERSION HISTORY  v1.126a Added a new Miner (lolMiner) for BTG which is â€œequihash 144-5â€ Added support for â€œconfig.override.jsonâ€ for easy deployment of large number of computers allowing a different computername for each system Display for low earning rate to show 3 digits after the dot for more accurate indication  v1.124a This is the first update that does not auto-update (for those who chose the manual (delayed) update mode) New WinMiner software GUI Added miner (ETN, XMR) for Windows 32 bit systems Bug fixes  v1.122a Following requests for a heads up on WinMiner updates, we have added a Manual update mode - which provides a delay, of usually 24 hours, from the moment an update is released until the auto update kicks in and updates WinMiner. This time delay allows users who wish to manually update their system to do so themselves.  v1.119a Implemented changes to support upcoming Cryptonight hard forks for Monero and Sumokoin Integrated XMR-stak (formerly on WinMiner for CPU only) to support both CPU AND GPU mining, for both AMD and nVidia, for cryptonight, Cryptonight Heavy and Cryptonight V7 Updated Cast-XMR to latest version to support upcoming hard fork (Cryptonight and Cryptonight V7) Updated Claymore CryptoNote CPU to the latest version Claymore latest GPU version integration completed and will kick in with the first block  v1.115a New added miner software: - Claymore Neoscrypt for AMD - ZMminer for Equihash Added Temp, Fan, Watt support for rigs with over 6 AMD GPUs Fixes for user reported bugs Fixed machine "idle" issue reported by some users Fixed "forget" issue reported by some users Auto countdown and window close for all system messages  v1.111a Added mkxminer, supporting lyra2v2 for AMDs Fixes for user reported bugs New benchmark algorithm (gen. II) - for greater profits and less benchmark time: - Improved crowd wisdom data use and reduced need for benchmark checks - Much quicker resolution to the best coin to mine for every specific machine - No more need for benchmark session once every 24hrs  v1.104a - v1.109a Added CastXMR miner for high-end AMD cards Fixes for user reported bugs Settings reset error fixed Dashboard performance improvements for accounts with over 100 machines  v1.104a Fixed GPU identification mixup - now the performance is shown next to the correct GPU Added GPU metric info: Fan speed, Temp, and power consumption (Watt) Live dashboard updated with the above features Social media links  v1.88a - v1.99a Ethminer  0.12 for cuda added Multi GPU rigs - alert and auto fix for virtual memory settings - for improved stability Bug and stability fixes  v1.87a AMD Vega - Cryptonote v10.2 Bug fixes  v1.86a Extra Command Line user customization - Phase 3 Added LiteCoin (LTC) to payment options Added a high fee BTC withdrawal option - for fast confirmation  v1.85a Extra Command Line user customization - Phase 2  v1.84a Extra Command Line user customization - Phase 1  v1.83a 2 Factor Authentication added for greater protection of users' funds  v1.80a / v1.82a Bug fixes  v1.79a Greater optimization for mixed rigs â€“ run one algo/miner/coin for AMD cards and a different one for Nvidia cards on the same rig Crowd wisdom â€“ New and updated benchmark data based on performance achieved by other users with similar hardware Target profit data shown at the start and throughout the benchmarking process   Housekeeping features: - Full screen detection in automatic mode â€“ mining will not start in full screen state - Option to remove count-down window - Debug log does not required re-run  v1.78a Bug fixes - reported UI issue  v1.77a Bug fixes - (including reported bugs - dual CPU, Live dashboard connection, benchmarking, idle mode, etc.)  v1.76a XMR-STAK for CPU added (currently only to users who opted-in for experimental versions)  v1.75a Bug fixes - mainly fixes for the reported issues with the new online dashboard. Boosted Skunk (SIGT) performance for high end GPUs - on top of the previous boost of yesterday  v1.74a New online dashboard - real time data (hash and profit) per machine per GPU per CPU  v1.73a Added Signatum coin Added machines filter in the statistics page  v1.72a Fixed Windows Defender dialog bug Auto detect running in non Admin Mode and prompt switch to Admin mode with a click Portable version - update mechanism fixed  v1.71a New message system improvements Remember last window position (including for multi screen) Added checkbox for start in minimized Portable version released - download here New withdrawal coin - Ethereum  v1.70a Fixed support for DMD coin Added error notifications on main screen Bug fixes  v1.66a Added Express benchmarking (see here) Added option to turn off a specific miner Fixed Wrong hash rate display for Nvidia cards Fixed Nvidia cards looping benchmark  v1.64a Fixed bug - long AppData folder path not supported  v1.63a Fixed bug - miners can't run when user name contains spaces  v1.62a Fixed the password strength error Fixed the benchmarking error â€“ it seems to be related to non-English OS languages  v1.60a Fixed network error handling on login Balance update set to every 5mins Fixed installer bug  v1.51a First Alpha release

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Thanks for being the first to comment and for your time looking at it There are two things we are trying to accomplish here: (1) An easy and accessible tool for everyone to use - so anyone can use this and enjoy it. So while crypto mining community as you say will prefer getting coins (which is an option) an everyday guy from Idaho (no offense  to anyone living there :-) ) who does not know how to handle coins may want cash or gift cards - we want to make all options available. (2) Optimizing the mining - our app will test which coin is the right coin to mine at any moment for a specific computer and will switch to the most profitable one. We think its cool and may interest crypto mining community members as well. With regard to your comment on Setup.exe - this is the way we write code that can be easily installed by anyone , and have done so for many years for many users to enjoy. If the community think that we should offer this in the form of zip file we will gladly do it. We worked on this product for several months giving it our best. We come in peace. Give us a chance

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: We are aware of this matter and working on enabling better control per GPU. On the technical side - this should be a no brainer if there was a clear identification and methodology for identifying the different GPUs by the miners that we could plug into. We believe this is something being dealt with by the Miners teams.  See Claymore latest update: Quote from: Claymore on April 11, 2016, 03:30:36 PM Latest version is v9.6: - new GPU sorting method for AMD cards. Now GPUs are sorted by physical bus index...  It is easier to fix when one GPU is AMD and the other NVidia, but more complex for multiple identical cards. Anyway we are working on this and will update when this capability is enabled. Thanks.

Author: TeamWinMiner
Title: WinMiner v1.126a - auto switch windows app for multi miner optimization
Body: Thanks for the feedback.   You have raised a couple of points: 1. Weak password â€“ for security reasons we chose to require passwords which contain lower case upper case numeric and special (!@# etc.) â€“ this requirement is shown on the page where a user is required to choose a password for the first time. Following your comment we will change the text in the dialog that comes up when a password does not meet the criteria â€“ instead of referencing â€œweak passwordâ€ we will reference â€œpassword does not meet the criteriaâ€ and mention the criteria again. 2. Windows Defender â€“ two points:     a. No need for disabling â€“ We prompt our users to exclude the WinMiner folder on Windows Defender (Not to disable Windows Defender altogether).     b. Best miners -  We want WinMiner to deliver the best profits to our users. To accomplish this we work with the best miner softwares available. Unfortunately some of the best miners (e.g. Claymore) are restricted by Windows Defender, and without them you will simply make less moneyâ€¦so itâ€™s your call whether to exclude or not. 3. Start button â€“ If you could use the bug reporting mechanism (see below) it will help us figure out what went wrong. 4. Bug reporting - We have built a mechanism in WinMiner that makes it real easy for users to report bugs and for us to get all the info we need to fix and get back to the user. Simply click on the Help drop down menu at the top right corner of the WinMiner screen, choose â€œsend error reportâ€ and make sure the â€œSend log filesâ€ box is checked. Please write your email address and any comment you want in the window and voila â€“ we get the info and can deal with it right away.   Hope this helps and clarifies.   Thanks again   Team WinMiner
